name: Park Hyatt Chicago

reviews.text: In my experience Chicago hotel rooms are often a bit of a let down, but not the room at the Park Hyatt. The staff were friendly and helpful. Honestly the only disappointment is that breakfast was supposed to have been included in the rate I booked, but the hotel would not honor it, saying that the rate was currently unavailable even though I had already booked it. A relatively minor thing, except it turned out the only other option for breakfast in the hotel was an omelette at NoMI that cost $40 with tip. That being said, it was a delicious and pleasant meal, and service was excellent. I look forward to returning for dinner. Getting back to what's important, though, the room was very large, modern and clean. The climate control worked well. Nice touches that were appreciated included electric window blinds; wifi (I still can't believe any reputable hotel would charge for it, and the Park Hyatt did not); a very large, clean and comfortable marble bathroom; a large bathtub and separate enclosed shower with two nozzles. The seventh floor fitness facility was excellent. It offered a surprisingly nice selection of good equipment and supplies like clean towels and fresh ice water with fruit and mint infusions. The locker room was also a very appropriate space. There was an overall clean, modern and luxurious feeling to the entire hotel. I wish I'd had more time to spend and hope I'll have the opportunity to visit again soon; next time for pleasure.
reviews.title: A beautiful Chicago hotel.

reviews.text: Stayed here for a medical conference. Was located very close to the conference but nothing else. The hotel was great but I didn't like the distance from food or entertainment. Had a couple good restaurants inside but the selection was limited.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: My husband, daughter and myself stayed at the Park Hyatt, Water Tower Square, from 9 - 13 July 2012. It was an amazing experience! Nothing too big or small for them to do - find a hairdresser, book tickets - absolutely anything, and with a smile! Donald and Karen at the Concierge desk were great. The room was perfect, and food great. A truly wonderful stay!
reviews.title: Excellent experience!

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights in Chicago at the Park Hyatt. Loved every minute of our stay. Staff and room could not have been better.
reviews.title: Fabulous Chicago Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently booked a night at the Park Hyatt via jetsetter. The hotel was in a great location and the rooms were great. Spacious, clean, and the decor was modern and stylish. The big negative negative was being double charged. Upon checking out, the front desk clerk said I was all set since I booked it on jetsetter, I told her I noticed a pending charge for the room and she said it would drop off and I wouldn't be charged since I had paid ahead of time. That wasn't the case. Now I have to call accounting (during business hours), and work with them to remove the charge. It's a shame, it was definitely one of the nicest hotels, but because of this I will not return or recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, sub par accounting

reviews.text: My family and I recently traveled to Chicago and stayed at the Park Hyatt. The property itself is beautiful and the rooms are spacious and modern. What sets this Hotel apart from other comparable properties is the level of personalized service offered to guests, from the bell and taxi personnel, to the concierge, management and cleaning crew. Everyone was extremely friendly to my family, something you don't often find in upper scale properties. The location is fantastic. The food at the restaurant was delicious. We arrived late and were offered dinner in the lounge. Again, the staff in the restaurant was very friendly and helpful. When we return to Chicago, we will again stay at the Park Hyatt.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in Chicago

reviews.text: FIrst, let me start by saying I'm not a Hyatt fan, but I've found Park Hyatt's to be a distinct step above in amenities and luxuries over your typical Hyatt hotels. This property did not disappoint. It has a lot going for it. A great location, terrific rooms with luxury baths, impeccable service (by the doormen and front desk), friendly staff, very clean and beautiful furnishings. Even complimentary internet!
reviews.title: Luxury next to the fire station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't give the hotel 5 stars for a few issues...one that really is just a function of its great location across from Watertower Place. There is a fire station with an ambulance a block away. It must be the busiest station in Chicago because they had a call literally ever 30 to 90 minutes both nights I was there. Although I couldn't hear a sound from any other room, I was woken up continuosly by the sirens wailing by the hotel when I was trying to sleep. Others in the hotel complained of the same problem.
reviews.title: Tasteful with just the right amount of hilariously fancy touches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was at the hotel for a business meeting and we had food catered by the hotel for both breakfast and lunch. It was good, but I wouldn't say it was great, given the price. I would venture out of the hotel for dinner.
reviews.title: Great location, nice property, could improve though...

reviews.text: My only other issue was poor service in the hotel bar.....which was annoying given there weren't many guests in the lounge. Our server was very nice, just moved the pace of a snail.
reviews.title: Meets and beats high expectations

reviews.text: If I were told i could only stay at one hotel the rest of my life, this would be it.
reviews.title: Absolute favorite hotel of them all..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have averaged +75 hotel nights per year for the last 15 years. I've stayed in everything from a Hampton inn to the Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, Penninsula and everything in between. I've seen awful and experienced flawless. THIS is flawless. I've stayed at this Park Hyatt over 10 different times. I've never had so much as an unpleasant moment at this property. Everything is decorated and/or performed at an outstanding yet unprententious level. Quiet dignity. Even the housekeepers are quiet: no noisy carts...
reviews.title: Exquisite, in a class of its own...

reviews.text: Rooms are suuuuupperr comfortable. Fluffy down duvets, modern bathrooms with tubs that can be entered directly from the bedroom or bathroom. This property is quiet, which I really appreciate in a noisy city. Higher floors are even more quiet, but I've never had a bad room anywhere. Try to get a lake view if possible. Room service is expensive and worth it, though there are many great eateries right outside your door. (including GHIRADELLI ice cream!) this property is convenient to several top tier stores in the area including Polo, and American Girl...
reviews.title: VERY FINE HOTEL

reviews.text: Work out facility is great w excellent locker rooms and spa services... I could go on and on.., this is an amazing place.
reviews.title: New favorite Hyatt Hotel - Extraordinary

reviews.text: Truly exceptional experience! Hotel facilities and amenities, and room furnishings are outstanding, staff knowledgeable, helpful, most elegant in manner... All-around a most wonderful experience!!!
reviews.title: A Hyatt when in need.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Park Hyatt (room 1716) for 3 nights in early August. I can’t say enough about how nice it was. The room was spacious, had a great view (not of the lake, but still great), an enormous bathroom with a separate room for the toilet, a soaking tub and a walk in shower. As far as I could tell this is a normal room. The windows were enormous and had electronic controls to open and close (that were located next to the bed). All of the lights were electronically controlled too. The TV was large and in HD. It really felt like home. The room did not have a coffee maker, but in the lobby there was a pantry room with Nespresso machines and pots of coffee. The lobby itself was gorgeous…Modern but with elements of understated art. The location of the hotel simply could not have been better. Turn down service each night was fantastic. Room service was prompt each morning and the food was well prepared. The restaurant NOMI (on the 7th floor) had a great view, but the food and service were not impressive. Could have been an off night. Bottom line…I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Top notch.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent a weekend at the Park Hyatt. The location is terrific in almost all respects but it is immediately near two hospitals and a fire station. As a consequence we were bombarded with sirens most of the night. The doorman was apologetic and said that even on the highest floors the residents complained.
reviews.title: A very good hotel with a serious noise problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was very good, the room well appointed and wi fi was complimentary. The entry was a little awkward, but the front desk staff was great. The fitness facility is very good though could use a couple more mats for floor work.
reviews.title: Room with a view

reviews.text: This is not the place for one sensitive to noise. It is noisier than most of the New York hotels we use.
reviews.title: Honeymoon at the Park

reviews.text: We visited Chicago for my husband's birthday for a long weekend. We stayed in an Executive Suite at the Park Hyatt on N. Michigan Ave right on the Magnificent Mile. Our room had a spectacular view of the West Water Tower. We arrived a little early and our room wasn't ready so we went and explored some of the city. When we returned we were told that they had upgraded our room. The room was perfect - spacious, clean and with an exceptional view to look out over the acivities below
reviews.title: Typical Park Hyatt Awesomeness

description: Flagship luxury hotel, Park Hyatt in Chicago's best location.
